com.orchestranetworks.ui.form.widget
Interface UIAtomicWidget

All Superinterfaces:
UIWidget
All Known Subinterfaces:
UIAtomicWithEnumeration, UICheckBoxGroup, UIComboBox, UIDateTime, UIDropDownList, UIListBox, UIRadioButtonGroup, UITextBox
public interface UIAtomicWidget
extends UIWidget

This interface is common to all EBX5 model-driven widgets based on a single data model field. These widgets are able to adapt their behavior to their field's definition in the data model (data type, display, user input validation, etc).

Since:
5.3.0

Method Detail

getActionOnAfterValueChanged

public JsFunctionCall getActionOnAfterValueChanged()
See Also:
setActionOnAfterValueChanged(JsFunctionCall)

setActionOnAfterValueChanged

public void setActionOnAfterValueChanged(JsFunctionCall aFunctionToBeCalled)
Sets an action on the client-side that is triggered after the user has changed the value of the component.

When the action is triggered, the JavaScript function is called as follows:

<myFunction>(<val> [, <myArg>]);

, where <myFunction> is the name of aFunctionToBeCalled and <val> is the value of the field; its type and format depend on the widget's class and is documented in the widget's Javadoc, under the section 'JavaScript type'. The second argument <myArg> is optional and is passed as a parameter only if specified by aFunctionToBeCalled.

Note: If Ajax prevalidation is enabled for the component, the action is triggered after the confirmation of the Ajax prevalidation (and it may take some time). The triggering event is not directly related to a particular HTML event.

Parameters:
aFunctionToBeCalled - the JavaScript function to be called after the user has changed the value of the component.

isAjaxPrevalidationEnabled

public boolean isAjaxPrevalidationEnabled()
Returns:
true if the Ajax prevalidation is enabled, false otherwise.
See Also:
setAjaxPrevalidationEnabled(boolean)

setAjaxPrevalidationEnabled

public void setAjaxPrevalidationEnabled(boolean isEnabled)
Ajax prevalidation is used to send the value entered by the user (usually when the client leaves the field) to the server. Hence, the value can be validated and the validation messages can be raised automatically on the screen near the field.

Ajax prevalidation does not persist the data. Data entered by the client are kept in a temporary context used to validate the form.

Ajax prevalidation is also essential for linked lists. When enabled, the server is aware of what each field contains, and thus can provide the dynamic list when the user opens it.

Default value is false.

Parameters:
isEnabled - enables Ajax prevalidation so as to automatically display validation error messages on the page.
